intro: Stephanodaphne capitata, commonly known as the clustered stephanodaphne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters at the tips of its stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
